poem:
Title: The Last Supper's Lament

Lost, our sweet chocolate dreams and sips of wine,
Caffeinated secrets of mornings, no longer divine.
An echo of a feast, where scarcity is the main course,
The Last Supper of earth, imbued with regret and remorse.
A palate in the wake of apocalypse,
Mourning for the world, with every lost eclipse.
